title: Configurable social media links in footer (Next Time Vacations)

requirements.summary: Replace placeholder footer social icon links with real, accessible links that open in a new tab.
acceptanceCriteria: The Facebook/X/Instagram/LinkedIn icons in the footer link to real URLs (not "#").
Each social link opens in a new tab and uses rel="noopener noreferrer".
Each icon link has an accessible label (e.g., aria-label) describing the destination social network.

file_operations.description: Update the footer social icon anchors to use configured URLs, add target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer", and add per-network accessible labels (e.g., aria-label). Ensure the existing phone number text "Call us: 434-238-8796" remains unchanged.

requirements.summary: Introduce a single, code-based configuration export for footer social URLs and render only links with defined URLs.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a single, clearly named config export (e.g., SOCIAL_LINKS) that contains the footer social URLs.
Footer.tsx reads social URLs from this config rather than hardcoding them inline.
If a social URL is empty/undefined, its icon is not rendered in the footer.

file_operations.description: Create a clearly named exported configuration (e.g., SOCIAL_LINKS) containing the footer social URLs for Facebook, X, Instagram, and LinkedIn so updates happen in one place without editing Footer markup.

Import the SOCIAL_LINKS config and render the social icon links by reading from the config; conditionally omit any icon whose configured URL is empty/undefined. Keep footer layout and the phone number display unchanged.
